page.title: 01Starston An arable landscape
page.content: This quiet unsophisticated corner of South Norfolk includes the village of Starston and the outskirts of Harleston, Needham and Pulham St Mary. It is flat open farming land criss crossed with country lanes which were once hedged and ditched but are now mostly cultivaed up to te roadside. Throughout the block there is a scattering of small hamlets and isolated farms. The farms are not large, covering between 10 and 200 acres. Agriculture is predominantly arble, the main crops being wheat, barley, sugarbeet and oil seed rape. one recent change has been the disappearance of dairy cattle. this is due to EEC monetary incentives to discourage the produciton of milk. There remain a few intensive units of pig, poultry and beef cattle.
